title: Putin Sees Ukraine Through a Lens of Grievance Over Lost Glory
summary: Speaking after Friday’s summit, President Putin again implied that the war is all about Russia’s diminished status since the fall of the Soviet Union.

title: Ukrainians Fleeing Russia’s Attacks Say the Alaska Summit Was an Insult
summary: Evacuees at a shelter in eastern Ukraine reacted angrily to talk that land that has long been theirs could be given to Russia in exchange for peace.

title: Ukraine Weighs Trump’s Offer of Security Guarantees With Caution
summary: President Trump offered security guarantees to deter future Russian aggression. But the offer was vague, prompting Kyiv to seek clarity.

title: At Trump and Putin Summit, an Alaskan Halibut Dish Gets a Cameo
summary: Halibut Olympia, a Tuesday-night kind of recipe, was part of the planning (if not the eating) at the Friday meeting.

title: Trump’s Selective Stance on Justice: Redemption for Some, Scorn for Others
summary: President Trump, himself a felon, has shown particular leniency to criminals he seems to identify with — people who are white or wealthy, or who rioted in his name on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Jeanine Pirro Takes on Prosecutor Role in Trump’s D.C. Crackdown
summary: As the U.S. attorney in Washington, Jeanine Pirro is a central player in a clash that could define her legacy: the president’s takeover of local law enforcement.

title: Israel Says Iranian Agents Recruited Dozens of Its Citizens
summary: The agents cajoled people into acts of sabotage and even assassination plots. The cases have raised questions about greed, gullibility and loyalty.

title: Israelis Join Nationwide Rallies to Call for Release of Hostages
summary: It was unclear how many people would join the planned day of action, which was expected to culminate with a large evening demonstration.

title: U.S. Pauses Visitor Visas for Gazans After Laura Loomer Posts
summary: The move blocked a pathway for those seeking medical care in the United States, including young children, who have arrived in recent weeks with serious conditions.

title: Penn & Teller’s Secret to a 50-Year Partnership
summary: As their magic act hits 50 years, they’re bigger than ever. They say their secret is not to socialize. But misdirection is also their love language.

title: Redistricting Push Would Further Divide a Polarized Congress
summary: Many state delegations are already under single-party control. New maps could tighten the partisan grip while decreasing the importance of general elections.

title: Protesters Gather to Oppose Trump’s Push on Redistricting
summary: Thousands assembled around the country to demonstrate against a Republican effort to redraw congressional maps in their favor for 2026.

title: Three Are Killed in Shooting at Crown Heights Bar
summary: Eight others were taken to the hospital with injuries after the early morning shooting in Brooklyn.

title: North Carolina Confederate Monument Goes Too Far, Lawsuit Says
summary: A long battle over the pro-slavery words on a Tyrrell County statue intensifies as the Trump administration reclaims Confederate imagery.

title: They’re Stuffed Animals. They’re Also A.I. Chatbots.
summary: New types of cuddly toys, some for children as young as 3, are being sold as an alternative to screen time — and to parental attention.

title: The C.E.O. of Duolingo Wants to Have a Conversation About A.I.
summary: The language-learning app with more than 100 million users has embraced artificial intelligence but has also faced consumer backlash for it.

title: Evo Morales, Barred from Bolivia’s Election, Urges Null Votes
summary: Despite being barred from running again for president and being sought for arrest, a towering figure of Bolivian politics is trying to rally supporters to cast null votes.

title: What to Know About Bolivia’s Presidential Election
summary: An economic crisis and political infighting among the country’s long-dominant socialist party could pave the way for the first right-wing president in decades.

title: Sure, These Comics Can Make You Laugh. But Can They Hit a Jump Shot?
summary: A weekly pickup basketball game in Manhattan is populated almost entirely by professional funny people from all corners of the comedy landscape — stand-up comedians on their way up, comics past their primes and even industry A-listers.

title: Trump’s Domestic Deployments Are Dangerous. For the Military.
summary: The nation’s most trusted institution must not be reduced to a political tool.

title: The Insidious Creep of Trump’s Speaking Style
summary: The fact that we’re talking like Donald Trump could mean that we’re starting to think like him as well.

title: Is it Actually Fine to Look at Your Phone Before Bed?
summary: Scientists offer some surprising answers.

title: What Do You Want to See in New York’s Future?
summary: We’ve been envisioning how some of today’s biggest dilemmas could transform the city. We’d like you to imagine with us.

title: Government Shuts Down Air Canada Strike That Grounded Hundreds of Flights
summary: A walkout by flight attendants ended after about 12 hours with the imposition of binding arbitration. But getting travel back to normal will take days.

title: An Arts District Helped Make Asheville a Destination. Its Recovery Is Slow Going.
summary: Nearly a year after Hurricane Helene severely damaged the popular River Arts District, the rebuilding process continues in a gradual manner.

title: Louisiana Has a Long History of Political Corruption
summary: For decades, Louisiana lawmakers at all levels of government have been caught up in corruption allegations.
